description: Tackling transport crime and disorder is one of our main priorities. We are committed to helping to bring real benefits to our passengers, staff and the wider community.

The transport system in London is a low-crime environment, and the risk of becoming a victim of crime while travelling on it is low.

However, crime, antisocial behaviour and the fear of crime can have a major effect on people's willingness to travel and access jobs and services. Improving safety and security will help improve the quality of life and make London a fairer and more prosperous city. We must continue efforts that have been successful in reducing crime and antisocial behaviour, and identify opportunities and areas for improvement.

Our Directorate of Enforcement and On-Street Operations (EOS) is responsible for community safety, enforcement and policing across London's transport system. This means it coordinates a range of schemes that aim to improve safety and security when travelling in London.
EOS works with partners to Rail Delivery Group .

We are subject
        to Section 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 which means we have to
        do all we reasonably can to reduce crime and disorder on the transport
        system.

The legislation focuses on how our delivery of core
        services, along with our public authorities, can make a significant
        difference to crime reduction in local communities.
